main.name: Jacqueline Moore
main.description: a writer, a photographer, and a climber.
main.bio: I plan to graduate from UC Davis in June of 2021 with a B.S. in biomedical engineering and a minor in English. I'm interested in applying my unique academic background and previous internship experience to expand my technical writing and project management skills.
main.listIntro: But there's more to me than my resume. You might be interested to know that:
bioList: My favorite podcast is called 'No Such Thing As A Fish.'
One of my personal goals is to complete a wintertime summit of Mount Shasta.
Another goal is to bake the perfect loaf of banana bread.
If I had to choose my favorite book, I'd pick Ian McEwan's 'Atonement.'
The worst book I've ever read is 'The Catcher in the Rye.'
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

education.description: College of Engineering Dean's List, College of Letters and Science Dean's List.

work.title: Technical Writing Intern
work.description: Leading the production of a user help video about a beta feature of Einstein Analytics. Drafting a proposal that defines methods and best practices for maintaining internal demo environments for technical writers.

work.title: Extern
work.description: Attended virtual lectures and completed online exercises pertaining to project management and business communications.

work.title: Technical Writing Intern
work.description: Drove the creation of an interactive module for a user-facing, instructional applet about key concepts of data analysis. Collaborated cross-team with technical writers, product managers, and developers to design and build the user interface.

work.title: Technical Writing Intern
work.description: Collaborated with software engineering interns to write and edit external software manuals. Drafted and designed email campaigns about newly-released features in HTML and CSS.

work.title: Marketing Intern
work.description: Launched client interview protocol for self-driven community outreach project. Conducted interviews of clients, then wrote personal profiles about interviewees.

activities.title: Microfluidics Team Lead
activities.description: Co-leading a 10-person research team in constructing two cost-efficient microfluidic controllers for RNA sequencing. Also collaborating with teammates to design and build microfluidic chips using AutoCAD and UV exposure systems (for low-cost photolithography).

activities.title: Vice President of Outreach and Content Strategy
activities.description: Designing and building the organization's website using Figma and Squarespace. Spearheading the creation and release of monthly newsletters that detail research teams' progress, share news for students, and highlight specific members of the organization.

activities.title: Copy Editor
activities.description: Proofreading copy — roughly 25 articles per week — using The Aggie's variation of the AP Style Guide. Previously served the paper as a campus news reporter, which involved composing one article per week and conducting relevant, in-person interviews.

writing.title: COPY: remote.it email update for new feature
ESSAY: Training a convolutional neural network to identify circulating tumor cells
ARTICLE: Coverage of lecture delivered by visiting law professor

projectmgmt.title: Applet instructing users about data analysis with tables in Einstein Analytics

designs.title: Prototype submitted to the 2020 Airbnb + Adobe Creative Jam
Website designed and built for BioInnovation Group
Digital newsletters designed and created for BioInnovation Group

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
